ingredientList:
1 10 3/4-ounce can cream of mushroom soup
1 10 3/4-ounce can cream of chicken soup
3 pounds ground beef
1 pound Mexican cheese
recipeText:
Brown hamburger, drain grease.  

Mix in soups and cheese until cheese is melted and ingredients are hot.

ingredientList:
1 pound imitation crab meat
1 small onion (you can use purple onions)
1 bottle (small Kraft) ranch salad dressing
1/2 jar Kraft mayonnaise
2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
2 cups shredded Swiss cheese
recipeText: Mix and eat!

ingredientList:
1 tube sugar cookie dough (homemade or store bought)
8 ounces cream cheese
1/3 cup sugar
1 cup pineapple tidbits
2 kiwi fruits, peeled and sliced
1 cup strawberries, sliced
1 cup blueberries
recipeText:
Spread sugar cookie dough on pizza pan.  Bake as directed.  Cool crust to room temperature.  

Mix cream cheese with sugar to taste as you wish.  

Right before serving, spread cream cheese mixture over cookie dough crust.  
Top with fruit of your choice.   

For fancy snacks, use digestive biscuits or small sugar cookies instead of making sugar cookie crust on pizza pan.

ingredientList:
8 cups well drained tomatoes
2 1/2 cups onions
2 cups green, red, or any sweet peppers
1/2 cup hot jalapeno peppers
6 cloves garlic
2 teaspoons cumin
2 teaspoons pepper
2 tablespoons canning or pickling salt
1/3 cup sugar
1/3 cup vinegar
1 16-ounce can tomato sauce
1 12-ounce can tomato paste
recipeText: Mix all ingredients together.  Boil for 10 - 15 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 big ripe avocados, peeled and seed removed
8-ounce package cream cheese
8 ounces sour cream
Pinch garlic salt
1 1/2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese
1 1/2 cups diced tomatoes
1 1/2 cups shredded lettuce
Optional picante sauce
recipeText:
Mash and mix the avocados, cream cheese, sour cream, and garlic salt until creamy. Spread on a pizza pan.

Top with shredded cheese, diced tomatoes, shredded lettuce, and picante sauce.

ingredientList:
2 packages crescent roll dough
8 ounces cream cheese, softened
1/2 ounce ranch salad dressing mix
1/3 cup mayonnaise
1/2 teaspoon dill weed
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1/4 teaspoon garlic salt
Small pieces of cauliflower, broccoli, & carrots
Shredded cheddar cheese
recipeText:
Roll out the dough and bake at 350 degrees for 13 minutes.

Mix the remaining ingredients except cheese and veggies.  Spread cream cheese mix on cooled crust.  

Spread cheese and veggies over the cream cheese mix.  Cut and serve.

ingredientList:
2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/2 cup melted butter
1/4 cup sugar
3 cups coconut
1 can sweetened condensed milk
1 tablespoon peanut butter
1 package semisweet chocolate chips
recipeText:
Mix cracker crumbs, sugar, and butter and press hard in a 9" x 13" pan.  Bake 10 minutes at 350 degrees.
  
Mix together coconut and condensed milk and pour over crust.  Bake for an additional 15 minutes at 350 degrees. 
 
Melt chocolate chips.  Add peanut butter.  Pour mixture over the top of the bars.  Cool and eat!

ingredientList:
1 (12-ounce) bag semisweet chocolate chips
1 (12-ounce) bag butterscotch chips
1 1/2 cups peanut butter
1 cup miniature marshmallows
1 cup peanuts (optional: pecans or walnuts)
recipeText:
Melt the peanut butter, chocolate and butterscotch chips.  

Mix in marshmallows and peanuts.  

Pour into a 9" x 13" pan.  

Cool, cut, and eat.

ingredientList:
1 cup corn syrup
1 cup sugar
1 cup peanut butter
6 cups crispy rice cereal
1 cup salted peanuts
1 10-ounce package M&M's
recipeText:
Grease a 9" x 13" pan with butter.

Combine syrup and sugar and peanut butter in a pan.  Heat until melted stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.

Add cereal, peanuts, and M&M's.  Pat into the pan..

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups boiling water
1 cup oatmeal
1/2 cup margarine
1 cup brown sugar
1 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Frosting:
1/2 cup butter or margarine
1 cup brown sugar, packed
1 tablespoon milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup coconut
1/2 cup chopped nuts
recipeText:
Pour boiling water over oatmeal and let stand for 20 minutes.  Cream sugar and margarine, beat in eggs, and sifted dry ingredients all at once.  

Add vanilla and beat.  Add oatmeal and water and blend well.  Bake on greased cookie sheet at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

Frosting:  Boil frosting ingredients except coconut and nuts.  Blend in coconut and nuts and spread on cake while it is still hot.  Cool and Cut.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup corn syrup
1/2 cup sugar
3/4 cup peanut butter
3 cups crispy rice cereal
1 package semisweet chocolate chips
1/2 package butterscotch chips
recipeText:
Combine syrup and sugar in a pan.  Heat until melted.  Don't boil!  Remove from heat.

Add peanut butter and mix throughly.  

Fold in cereal and pat into a buttered pan.  

Melt the chips and pour over top.

recipeName: Pillsbury Bake Off 1975 - Pecan Frosting Mix Substitute
recipeDescription: This recipe can be used as a substitution for a box of Pecan Frosting Mix.
ingredientList:
1 cup sweetened flaked coconut
3/4 cup brown sugar, firmly packed
1/2 cup flour
1/2 cup chopped pecans
3 tablespoons butter or margarine
recipeText:
In medium bowl, combine coconut, brown sugar, flour, and pecans; mix well. 

Using fork or pastry blender cut in butter or margarine.

ingredientList:
1 package Pecan Frosting Mix
3 cups rolled oats
1 cup margarine
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
3/4 cup peanut butter
recipeText:
See the Pecan Frosting Mix Substitute recipe.

Mix frosting mix, oats, and margarine.  Press in a bar pan and bake for 15 to 20 minutes at 350 degrees.

Melt chocolate chips and peanut butter.  Spread on bars while they are still warm.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup butter or margarine
2 cups vanilla wafers, crushed
1 cup coconut
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips or butterscotch chips.
1 cup nuts
1 14-ounce can sweetened condensed milk
recipeText:
Melt the butter in a 8" x 12" pan.  On the melted butter, put the crushed wafers.  Then top with the remaining ingredients in the order given.  Do not mix. 

Bake at 325 degrees for 25 minutes.  Cut when cool.

ingredientList:
1 cup butter
1 cup brown sugar
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 3/4 cups oats
1 3/4 cups flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 cups raisins
1/2 cup water
4 egg yolks
1 cup sour cream
3 tablespoons cornstarch
1 1/2 cups sugar
1 cup half and half
1 tablespoon butter or margarine
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Mix the ingredients from the butter to the salt.  Put half of the crumbs in a 15" x 11" cookie sheet or jelly roll pan.  Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.  

Cook raisins in water until tender.  Add remaining ingredients, except vanilla, and cook until thick.  

Add the vanilla.  Pour filling on top of the crust; then sprinkle the remaining crust mixture on top.  Bake at 350 degrees for 15 - 20 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon salt
1 cup shortening
1 egg yolk (separate yolk and white, keeping both)
Milk (enough to make 2/3 cup with egg yolk in cup)
Corn flake crumbs
8 - 10 apples
1 cup sugar
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 egg white
1 cup powdered sugar
Dash vanilla extract
1 teaspoon water
recipeText:
Mix milk and egg yolk, flour, salt, shortening.  Roll 1/2 of dough to fill 10 1/2" x 15 1/2" cookie tray.  Sprinkle bottom of crust with cornflakes.  

Peel and slice apples and place over flakes.  Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon.  Roll out other half of dough and place on top.  Pinch edges.  Beat egg white stiff and brush over crust. 

Bake at 400 degrees for 60 minutes.

Frosting: Mix powdered sugar, vanilla, and water.  Drizzle frosting over bars.

ingredientList:
2 eggs
1 1/2 cups sugar
2 1/2 cups flour
1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup walnuts
1 1/2 cups coconut
1 16-ounce can undrained fruit cocktail

Topping:
3/4 cup sugar
1/2 cup butter
1/4 cup Carnation evaporated milk
1/2 cup chopped nuts
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Cream eggs and 1 1/2 cups sugar.  Mix with flour, soda, 1 teaspoon vanilla, salt, walnuts, coconut, and fruit cocktail.  

Spread mixture in 2 greased and floured cake pans or 1 jelly roll pan (cookie sheet with sides).  

Bake at 325 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes.  

In the meantime, boil 3/4 cup sugar, butter, Carnation, and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla for two minutes.  Add the 1/2 cup chopped nuts and cool slightly.  

Pour over the fruit cocktail bread while it is still warm.

recipeDescription: From Mae Carol, the best elementary school cook ever!
ingredientList:
18 ounces semisweet chocolate chips
3/4 cup peanut butter
3 cups peanuts
2 cups miniature marshmallows
recipeText:
Melt chocolate chips.  Add peanut butter.  Stir in peanuts & marshmallows.  Place in 9" X 13" pan and let cool.

(Alternate: use 12 oz chocolate chips and 6 to 12 oz butterscotch chips.)

ingredientList:
1/2 cup margarine
1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1 14-ounce can sweetened condensed milk
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1 cup walnuts
1 1/3 cups coconut
recipeText:
In a 13" x 9" baking pan, melt margarine.  Sprinkle crumbs over margarine, mix and press into pan.  Pour condensed milk over crumbs.  Top evenly with chocolate chips, walnuts, and coconut.  Press down firmly.

Bake at 350 degrees (325 degrees for glass dish) for 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly browned.  

Cool thoroughly before cutting.  Store loosely covered at room temperature. 

Makes 24 bars.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups flour
3/4 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup butter
1 can mixed nuts
1/2 cup white syrup
2 tablespoons butter
6 ounces butterscotch chips
recipeText:
Mix flour, brown sugar, and 1/2 cup butter.  Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes in a 9" x 13" pan.  Cool for 10 minutes.  Spread the nuts over the crust.  

Melt syrup, 2 tablespoons butter, and butterscotch chips over low heat.  Pour over nuts.  

Bank an additional 10 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/2 cup powdered sugar
1/2 cup margarine, melted
2 cups coconut
1 can Borden Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
4 bars Hershey's chocolate
recipeText:
Mix crackers, powdered sugar, and margarine.  Press in a 12" x 7-1/4" cookie sheet pan.  Bake at 325 degrees for 10 minutes.

Mix coconut and sweetened condensed milk.  Spread on hot crust, bake 10 minutes.

Melt the chocolate chips and chocolate bars.

Spread on hot coconut mix.

Sprinkle with almonds, if desired.

ingredientList:
3 cups soft bread crumbs (6 slices of bread)
2 cups milk
1/2 cup sugar
2 eggs
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup raisins
Sugar and cinnamon mixture
recipeText:
Spray 9x9x2 inch baking dish with non-stick spray.  Mix all ingredients together.  Pour mixture into dish, sprinkle top with cinnamon and sugar.  

Bake 40-45 minutes, at 350 degrees, or until knife inserted comes out clean.  Serve with ice cream.

ingredientList:
2 cups lukewarm water
1 cup sugar
1/2 cup mazola (corn) oil
2 teaspoons salt
4 eggs, beaten
2 packages dry yeast
2 teaspoons sugar
9 cups flour
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients.  Rise until double in size, then punch down and let rise again.

Bake at 350 degrees.  For soft buns, butter top of dough with melted butter before and after baking.

For dark buns, use 3 cups dark flour and 6 cups white flour.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups sugar
3/4 cup margarine or apple sauce
3 eggs, beaten
3 large bananas (1 cup mashed)
3 cups flour
1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
10 ounces maraschino cherries
1/4 cup cherry juice
1/4 cup walnuts
6 ounces semisweet chocolate chips
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients (except cherries) together, slowly mix in cherries, pour mixture into 2 bread loaf pans.  Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

For a healthier twist:  
Use 3/4 cup apple sauce instead of margarine.
Use 2 1/2 cups flour and 1/2 cup oats instead of 3 cups of flour.

recipeName: Cinnamon Bread Pudding with Butter Sauce
ingredientList:
6 eggs
1 3/4 cups half and half or light cream
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
2 cups milk
1 cup sugar
6 cups cubed cinnamon bread or rolls

Butter Sauce:
1/2 cup brown sugar
1/4 cup butter
1/3 cup light corn syrup
1/4 cup half and half or light cream
recipeText:
Beat eggs, milk, 1 3/4 cups cream, 1 cup sugar, and vanilla until combined.  Stir in cinnamon bread.  Grease a 2-quart baking dish.  Add bread pudding mixture, spreading evenly.  

Bake at 325 degrees for 55 - 60 minutes until the top is puffed and a knife inserted comes out clean.  

Butter Sauce: 
In a small saucepan, heat brown sugar and 1/4 cup butter.  Carefully add 1/3 cup light corn syrup and 1/4 cup cream.  
Cook 1 to 2 minutes until sugar is dissolved and mixture is smooth.  Serve over warm pudding.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup shortening
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup water
1 cup flour
4 eggs
Heavy cream
recipeText:
Bring shortening and water to a boil.  Stir in sifted flour and salt slowly.  Beat constantly until mixture leaves sides of pan and form into a ball (about 4 minutes).

Remove from heat and cool.  Add 4 eggs, one at a time, beating until smooth after each egg addition.  

Drop spoonfuls onto greased baking sheet.

Bake at 400 degrees for 45 - 50 minutes. 

Cool and fill with whipped cream.  Can also use ice cream or sweetened fruit. 

Makes 12 cream puffs.

ingredientList:
2 tablespoons soft butter
3/4 cup sugar
2 eggs, beaten
1 cup milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
3 cups flour
3 tablespoons baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
recipeText:
Combine the butter, sugar, and eggs.  Then add in milk and vanilla.  Lastly, mix in the remaining ingredients.

Deep fat fry at 375 degrees to 400 degrees.

ingredientList:
1 package Pillsbury hot roll mix
3/4 cup warm water
1 egg
3 tablespoons sugar
1 teaspoon maple extract
6 tablespoons margarine or butter, melted
1/2 cup sugar
1 teaspoon maple extract
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/3 cup nuts
1 1/2 cups powdered sugar
1/4 teaspoon maple extract
2 - 3 tablespoons milk
recipeText:
Prepare dough using roll mix, water, egg, 3 tablespoons of sugar, and 1 teaspoon of maple extract.  Let dough rise until light and double size, 30 - 45 minutes.

Filling:  Combine 1/2 cup sugar, cinnamon, 1 teaspoon of maple extract, and nuts.

Divide dough into 3 equal balls.  Roll one out to a 12 inch circle.  Place on greased 12 inch pizza pan.  Brush dough with 2 tablespoons melted butter.  Sprinkle on 1/3 of the filling.  Repeat, layering the dough and filling, ending with filling on top.  

Use a glass to mark a 2-inch circle in the center.  DO NOT CUT!  Now cut 16 wedges just to the circle.  Twist each 3-layer wedge 5 times.  Let rise until double in size, 30 - 45 minutes.

Bake at 375 degrees for 20 - 25 minutes.  

Glaze: mix powdered sugar, 1/4 teaspoon maple extract, and 2 - 3 tablespoons milk.  Drizzle over twists while still warm.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups sugar
1 cup buttermilk
2/3 cup vegetable oil
2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1 egg, beaten
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 1/2 cups diced rhubarb
1/2 cup chopped walnuts

TOPPING:
1/4 cup packed brown sugar
1/4 cup chopped nuts
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
recipeText:
In a medium mixing bowl, combine all ingredients except rhubarb, nuts, and topping ingredients. Gently stir in rhubarb and nuts.  

Spoon the batter into 24 greased muffin cups. Combine topping ingredients and sprinkle over tops of muffins. 

Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until muffins test done.

ingredientList:
1 package yellow (lemon) cake mix
1 package (3 1/2 ounce) instant vanilla pudding
3/4 cup oil
3/4 cup water
4 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 teaspoon butter extract
1/2 cup sugar
2 teaspoons cinnamon
recipeText:
Mix the cake mix, pudding, oil, water, eggs, vanilla and butter extracts for 8 minutes on high speed.

Mix sugar and cinnamon.

Grease 2 loaf pans.  Pour 1/4 of the batter in each.  Alternate between cinnamon mixture and the batter.

Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 cups lukewarm water
1 cup sugar
1/2 cup mazola (corn) oil
2 teaspoons salt
4 eggs, beaten
2 packages dry yeast
2 teaspoons sugar
9 cups flour
Candied Fruit
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients.  Rise until double in size, then punch down and let rise again.

Bake at 350 degrees.  For soft buns, butter top of dough with melted butter before and after baking.

For dark buns, use 3 cups dark flour and 6 cups white flour.

ingredientList:
2/3 cup sour cream
2/3 cup sour milk
1 cup sugar
3 eggs
3 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
2 teaspoons baking powder
Pinch salt
1 teaspoon nutmeg
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
If you don't have sour cream or sour milk, add 1 tablespoon of vinegar to the cup of milk or cream.  

Whip sour cream and sour milk.  Add sugar.  Add eggs one at a time while beating.  

Sift together flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.  Fold into mixture.  Add nutmeg and vanilla.  

Chill for several hours.  Don't chill too long or the dough gets too thick and won't come out of the doughnut maker. 

Deep fat fry.

ingredientList:
3 bananas
1 cup sugar
2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 cup shortening
1/2 cup walnuts
recipeText:
Mash bananas and mix with sugar.  Let stand 15 minutes.  Add the rest of the ingredients (except walnuts) and beat thoroughly.  Mix in walnuts.  

Bake in greased bread pan at 325 degrees for 50 - 60 minutes, or in cupcake tins for 20 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 pound Jimmy Dean Hot Sausage, brown and drain
9 eggs, beaten
3 cups milk
4 slices bread, cubed
1 1/2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese
1 1/2 teaspoons dry mustard
1 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons dried minced onion
recipeText:
Put browned sausage in the bottom of a 9"x13" pan.  Sprinkle with cheese and onion flakes.  Cover with bread.
In a separate bowl, mix egg , milk, mustard, and salt.  Pour mixture over the bread.

Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 cup brown sugar
1 cup butter
1/2 cup light corn syrup
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 bag Chester's Puffcorn
recipeText:
Mix the first four ingredients in a 2 quart saucepan and cook for 2 minutes.  Add baking soda, which will cause the mixture to foam.  Pour caramel mixture over the puffcorn and stir until mixed.  

Bake at 200 degrees for 45 minutes, stirring every 10 - 15 minutes.  Remove from oven and put on wax paper.  Break apart and eat.

ingredientList:
1 1/4 cups sugar
1/4 cup corn syrup
1/4 cup cold water
1 egg white
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/4 cup nuts
recipeText:
Cook sugar, corn syrup and water in 2-quart saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly, until sugar is dissolved. Cook, about 20 minutes, without stirring, to 260 degrees on candy thermometer or until small amount of mixture dropped into cup of very cold water forms a hard ball that holds its shape but is pliable.

Beat egg whites with electric mixer on high speed until stiff peaks form.  Continue beating constantly on medium speed while pouring hot syrup in a thin stream into egg whites. Add vanilla and food coloring if desired. Beat until mixture holds its shape and becomes slightly dull, scraping bowl occasionally.  Stir in nuts.

Quickly drop heaping teaspoonfuls of mixture from buttered spoon onto waxed paper. Let stand uncovered at room temperature at least 4 hours, but no longer than 12 hours until candies feel firm and are dry to the touch. Store in airtight container.

ingredientList:
1 12-ounce package (2 cups) semisweet chocolate chips
1 14-ounce can sweetened condensed milk
1 1/4 cups chopped walnuts
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Using a double boiler, combine chocolate chips and condensed milk.  Stir until the chocolate melts and mixture is smooth.  Stir in walnuts and vanilla.  

Spread evenly into foil-lined 9" round pan or 8" square pan.  Chill until firm, about 2 hours.  Cut wreath into 2" wedges or cut square into 1" squares.  Alternately, roll squares into balls and roll in finely chopped walnuts.

Makes about 64 squares.

recipeDescription: Makes 10 small lollipops or 30 mini candies.
ingredientList:
1 cup sugar
1/3 cup hot water
1/3 cup light corn syrup
1/2 teaspoon food coloring
1/2 teaspoon flavoring
Wilton super flex candy molds
recipeText:
Spray molds lightly with cooking spray.  Combine sugar, hot water, and corn syrup in a pan.  Place on high heat and stir until all sugar crystals are dissolved.  

Clip candy thermometer on the side of the pan and continue cooking without stirring.  When thermometer registers 300 degrees, remove pan from heat.  

Let mixture stand for 2 minutes until bubbles disappear.  Add flavoring and food coloring, stir to blend.  

Pour mixture into prepared molds and let harden at room temperature for 10 minutes.  Unmold.  Keeps for about 6 weeks.

ingredientList:
30 marshmallows
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/2 cup butter
Green food coloring
3 1/2 cups corn flakes
2 teaspoons red food coloring
recipeText:
Combine marshmallows, vanilla, and butter.  Beat until melted.  Put in corn flakes.  

Drop on wax paper and shape into wreaths.  

Put red dots on with food coloring.

ingredientList:
1 cup brown sugar
1 stick margarine or butter
1/4 cup white corn syrup
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
5 - 6 quarts popped corn
recipeText:
Combine all ingredients except baking soda and popcorn in a 1 1/2 or 2 quart dish.  Bring to a boil, then cook on full power for 2 minutes.  Remove from microwave and stir in baking soda.  

Put popped corn in a brown grocery bag.  Pour syrup over corn.  Close bag and shake.  

Cook in bag on high in microwave for 1 1/2 minutes.  Shake and cook another 1 1/2 minutes or more if needed.  

Pour into a pan and allow to cool.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup margarine
2 cups powdered sugar
14 ounces flaked coconut
1/4 cup sweetened condensed milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1 square bitter chocolate
3/4 of a bar of paraffin wax
recipeText:
Mix margarine, powdered sugar, coconut, sweetened condensed milk, and vanilla.  Make small balls and chill in the refrigerator.

Melt the chocolate and wax in a double boiler.  

Use a toothpick, spear the coconut balls and dip into the hot chocolate mixture.  Lay on wax paper to cool.  

Drop a little chocolate into the toothpick hole to hide it.

ingredientList:
3 cups corn syrup
3 teaspoons vinegar
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
3 quarts popcorn
recipeText: Boil syrup, vinegar, salt, and vanilla until mixture forms a hard ball when dropped from a spoon into cold water.  Then pour over popcorn and form into 3" balls.

ingredientList:
4 quarts popcorn (16 cups)
1 bag or jar of dry roasted peanuts
1 small bag of spiced gum drops
1/2 cup oils
1/2 cup butter
1 pound marshmallows
recipeText:
In a kettle, melt the oil, butter, and marshmallows.  Pour over the popped corn, nuts and gumdrops.  

Press into an angel food tin (pre-sprayed with Pam).  Unmold when cooled.

ingredientList:
4 quarts popcorn (16 cups)
2 cups mixed nuts
3/4 cup red & green gum drops
1 1/2 cups margarine
2 10 1/2-ounce bags marshmallows
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
In a kettle, melt the butter and marshmallows.  Add the vanilla.  Pour over the popped corn, nuts and gumdrops.  Mix well.  

Press into an angel food tin (pre-sprayed with Pam).  

Refrigerate 24 hours before taking out of pan.

ingredientList:
2 cups sugar
1 small can sweetened condensed milk
10 marshmallows
1 package semisweet chocolate chips
2 tablespoons melted butter
1/2 cup ground nuts (optional)
recipeText:
Bring sugar, condensed milk, and marshmallows to a rolling boil.  Then boil for 3 minutes.  Remove from heat.

Mix in the butter, chocolate chips, and nuts.  Pour into a buttered or foil lined dish and let cool.

ingredientList:
2 cups sugar
1 cup light corn syrup
1 1/2 teaspoons salt
2 tablespoons butter
1/4 teaspoon peppermint extract
7 drops green food coloring
1 1/2 cups water
recipeText:
Combine sugar, syrup, salt, & water in a 2-quart sauce pan.  Cook slowly until sugar dissolves.  Then cook to hard ball stage (260 degrees) without stirring.  Remove from heat.  

Stir in remaining ingredients.  Pour into buttered 15 1/2" x 10 1/2" x 1" pan.  Cool until comfortable to handle.  

Butter hands, gather taffy into a ball and pull.  When candy is light in color and hard to pull, cut into fourths.  Pull each piece into long strands about 1/2" thick.  

With buttered scissors, snip into bite size pieces.  Wrap each piece in wax paper.

ingredientList:
1 package dry  yeast
2 tablespoons warm water
1 cup margarine
3 cups flour
3 egg yolks
6 tablespoons milk
1 tablespoon sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 pound ground walnuts
1 cup sugar
Milk
Dash cinnamon
recipeText:
Sprinkle yeast on 2 tablespoons warm water and let stand for 5 minutes, mix.  Cut margarine into flour and mix well.  Add yeast mixture, yolks, milk, sugar, and vanilla.  Make into 9 balls and chill overnight.  

Mix walnuts, sugar, milk, and cinnamon.

Roll out dough (1 ball at a time) in powdered sugar into either a circle or rectangle.  Then cut pieces into squares or triangles.  Put a dab of nut filling in the center of each piece and roll piece.  Put on lightly greased cookie sheet.  Bake about 15 minutes at 350 degrees.  Dip in powdered sugar and let cool.  Nut rolls can be frozen.  If desired, sprinkle with a touch of powdered sugar just before serving.

ingredientList:
1 7-ounce jar marshmallow creme
2 1/4 cups powdered sugar
3 tablespoons water
17 ounces caramels
16 ounces salted peanuts
recipeText:
Knead together the marshmallow creme and powdered sugar.  Shape into small finger-like logs.  Place on waxed paper-lined cookie sheet and freeze.  

Melt caramels with water over a double boiler (or microwave).  Dip creme fingers into caramel mixture, then roll in chopped peanuts.  

Freeze until set.  Store in refrigerator.

ingredientList:
1 24-ounce package almond bark
8 ounces semisweet chocolate chips
1 cup peanut butter
24 ounces peanuts, without skins
recipeText: Melt almond bark and chocolate chips at a low temperature.  Stir in peanut butter and peanuts.  Drop on wax paper.

ingredientList:
1 1/3 cups sugar
1 cup butter
1/2 cup white syrup
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
4 quarts popcorn
recipeText: Boil sugar, butter, and syrup at low heat for 10 minutes.  Add vanilla.  Pour over popcorn.

ingredientList:
2 bags popcorn
1 cup margarine
2 cups brown sugar
1/2 cup corn syrup
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
recipeText:
Boil and simmer the margarine, brown sugar, and corn syrup.  Take off stove, add soda, and stir.  

Put popcorn in two cake pans, pour syrup over top, stir.  Bake in oven at 250 degrees.  Stir every 15 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 cup brown sugar
3 eggs
1 cup sugar
1 1/2 cups peanut butter
4 1/2 cups oatmeal
3/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 tablespoon corn syrup
1/2 cup butter
2 teaspoons baking soda
1/4 pound semisweet chocolate chips
1/4 pound M&M's
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients, except chocolate, in a large bowl.  Stir in chocolate.  You may also add raisins.  Drop onto greased cookie sheets.  

Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 cups sugar
1/2 cup shortening
1/2 cup milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 pinch salt
3 cups quick cook oats
1 cup coconut
5 tablespoons baking cocoa
1/2 cup nuts
recipeText:
Mix sugar, shortening, milk, vanilla, and salt in a pan and heat until boiling.  Pour over oats, coconut, cocoa, and nuts.  Mix well. 

Drop on waxed paper and let sit until cool.

ingredientList:
2/3 cup flour
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
1/2 cup packed brown sugar
1 egg
1 tablespoon dark rum or  orange juice
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 1/2 cups oats
3/4 cup mixed dried fruit
2/3 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1/2 cup sweetened flaked coconut
1/3 cup roasted salted peanuts
recipeText:
Heat the oven to 375 degrees.  Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.  

Beat butter and brown sugar in a large bowl at medium-high speed 3 - 4 minutes, or until light and fluffy.  Beat in egg, rum, and vanilla until smooth.  

At low speed, beat in flour, baking soda, and salt.  Stir in remaining ingredients.  (Dough will be very stiff.)

Drop dough by 1 1/2 tablespoons on baking sheets at least 3 inches apart.  Bake 8 to 11 minutes or until golden brown and set.  Cool completely on wire rack.  Best if eaten within 3 days.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups margarine
1 cup brown sugar
1 cup sugar
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon cinnamon
2 eggs
4 1/2 cups flour
Vanilla extract
1 cup nuts
recipeText:
Cream margarine and sugars.  Add eggs and beat well until "fluffy".  Add dry ingredients, vanilla and nuts.  Make about 4 rolls and chill overnight.  

Slice thin.  Bake at 350 degrees.

ingredientList:
1 cup sugar
1 egg
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup margarine
3 cups flour
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients together.  Roll out dough and cut with cookie cutters.

Bake at 350 degrees for 8 - 10 minutes.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup margarine
1/4 cup sugar
1/4 cup brown sugar
1 cup flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1 egg
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 cup nuts
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients.  Bake at 375 degrees for 8 - 10 minutes. 

Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
1 cup margarine
3/4 cup brown sugar
3/4 cup sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 eggs
1 tablespoon hot water
1 package semi-sweet chocolate chips
2 cups rolled oats
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients, except chocolate chips and oats, together.  When mixture forms a dough, add chocolate chips and oats.

Drop on greased cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 cup margarine
1 cup sugar
3 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
4 cups flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
Dates, ground
Sugar
Nuts
Leftover jams
recipeText:
Mix margarine, 1 cup sugar, eggs, vanilla, flour, baking powder, and salt.  

In a separate bowl, combine dates, some sugar, nuts, and any unused jams.  Can also add raisins, coconut, cookie crumbs, and maybe a little water. 

Roll out dough and cut in rounds, fill and with date mixture.

Bake.

ingredientList:
1 cup brown sugar
1 cup sugar
1 cup butter
2 eggs, beaten
2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon baking powder
2 cups oats
2 cups corn flakes
1 cup coconut
1 cup nuts
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Cream sugar, butter, and eggs.  Sift flour, salt, soda, and baking powder.  Add to creamed ingredients.  Add oatmeal, cornflakes, coconut, nuts, and vanilla.  

Roll into balls and press down on greased cookie sheet.  Bake 10 - 12 minutes at 350 degrees.

Makes 4 dozen cookies.  To vary recipe, add green and red maraschino cherries, cut into pieces, then bake.

ingredientList:
2 cups shortening
3 cups sugar
4 eggs
1/4 cup milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
5 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
recipeText:
Cream shortening, sugar, and eggs.  Stir in milk and vanilla.  Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together and stir into mixture until well blended.

Shape into a 1 1/2 inch thick roll.  Roll in waxed paper or wet cloth.  Chill several hours.  Slice thin.  

Bake at 35 degrees until light golden brown about 10 minutes.  

Makes 5 dozen cookies.

recipeName: Chocolate Chip Cookie Ice Cream Cake
ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs
6 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted
1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
3/4 cup mini semisweet chocolate chips
1 cup heavy cream
2 cups bittersweet chocolate chips
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/2 gallon vanilla ice cream
24 soft chocolate chip cookies, cut into 1/2-inch pieces.  (about 4 cups) Divided.
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.  Combine graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and cinnamon in medium bowl until crumbs are moistened; stir in 3/4 cup mini semisweet chocolate chips.  Press into bottom of 13" x 9" baking pan.  Bake 6 minutes until set.  Cool completely on wire rack.  

Meanwhile, heat cream in medium saucepan over medium heat until hot and steamy.  Remove from heat; add bittersweet chocolate chips.  Let stand 1 minute; stir until melted and smooth.  Stir in vanilla.  Cool 20 minutes or until room temperature.

Place ice cream in refrigerator 20 minutes or until slightly softened.  Spread half of the ice cream over crust; quickly spread with spatula to level.  Sprinkle half of the cookies over ice cream.  Quickly spoon 1 1/4 cups of the chocolate sauce over cookies and ice cream; spread with spatula to cover.  Freeze 15 minutes to firm sauce.

Quickly spread remaining ice cream over sauce.  Sprinkle with remaining cookies; drizzle with remaining sauce.  If necessary, warm sauce in microwave for 10 to 20 seconds or until desired consistency.  Sauce will not completely cover the top of the layer.

Freeze 2 hours to firm sauce.  Wrap tightly; freeze overnight or up to 1 week.  Place in refrigerator 20 to 30 minutes before serving to soften slightly.  Cut with warm knife.  Store in freezer.

recipeDescription: So very yummy!  Mom used to make this all the time when we were kids. - Melissa
ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups flour
1 cup chopped pecans, divided
1/2 cup margarine, melted
2 2/3 cups angel flake coconut
1 8-ounce package cream cheese, softened
3 cups milk
1 package (6 serving) instant vanilla pudding
1 8-ounce container cool whip
recipeText:
Combine flour, 1/2 cup pecans, & margarine.  Mix until flour is moistened.  Press evenly into the bottom of a 13" x 9" pan.  Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.  Cool.

Toast remaining pecans and 2/3 cup coconut on a baking sheet at 325 degrees for 5 minutes or until light brown.

Beat cream cheese until soft.  Add 1/2 cup milk and blend until smooth.  Add remaining milk and pudding.  Mix well.  Add untoasted coconut and mix.  Pour mixture over the crust.  

Spread whipped topping over the pudding and sprinkle with toasted mixture.  Keep refrigerated.

ingredientList:
1 21-ounce can strawberry pie filling
1 pint vanilla ice cream
1 tablespoon lemon juice
3 medium bananas
1/4 cup coarse chopped almonds
Lettuce
recipeText:
Stir pie filling, soft ice cream, and lemon juice together.  Then stir in bananas and nuts.  Place mix into 8 individual molds.  Cover; freeze until firm.  

To serve, let stand at room temperature for 10 minutes.  Unmold onto lettuce-lined plates.

ingredientList:
3 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/2 cup butter, melted
1 8-ounce package cream cheese
2 cups milk
1 3 1/2-ounce box instant vanilla pudding
1 quart strawberries, sliced lengthwise
1 8-ounce container cool whip
recipeText:
Mix graham cracker crumbs and butter.  Put 3/4 of crumbs in a 9" x 13" pan, saving 1/4 of crumbs for the topping.

Mix cream cheese and 1/2 cup milk until smooth.  Add vanilla pudding and remaining milk.  Mix for one minute until smooth.  Pour over crumbs.  Cover with sliced strawberries.

Top with cool whip and sprinkle on remaining graham cracker crumbs.

Refrigerate overnight.

ingredientList:
Ice Cream Dessert
1/2 cup margarine
1 cup coconut
2 1/2 cups crispy rice cereal (Rice Krispies)
3/4 cup brown sugar
1 cup nuts
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/2 gallon ice cream
recipeText:
Melt margarine.  Add coconut, cereal, & nuts.  Toast at 350 degrees for about 10 minutes.  Stirring so it does not burn, add vanilla and brown sugar.  After removing from oven, cool.  

Press half in bottom of a pan.  Slice Ice cream over the top.  Top with the remaining mixture & freeze.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup margarine
1/4 cup brown sugar
1 cup flour
1/2 cup chopped nuts
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 10-ounce package frozen strawberries, broken apart
2 egg whites
2 tablespoons lemon juice
1 cup sugar
1 cup heavy cream
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Make a "crust" by mixing the first 5 ingredients and bake in a 13" x 9" pan at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until light brown, stirring every 5 minutes.  

Mix strawberries, egg whites, lemon juice, and 1 cup of sugar.  Beat for 20 minutes until very stiff.  

Whip cream and 1 tsp. vanilla and fold into strawberry mix.  

Spoon some of the crust crumbs from the pan.  Top pan crumbs with strawberry mix, then top with spooned crumbs.

Keep Frozen.

ingredientList:
1 envelope unflavored jello
1/4 cup cold water
1/2 cup boiling water
1 cup strained orange juice
1 cup sugar
1 pint heavy cream, whipped
1 angel food cake, cooked
recipeText:
Dissolve unflavored jello in boiling water then stir in cold water.  Add orange juice and sugar and stir until completely dissolved.  Refrigerate until it becomes a heavy syrup.  Fold in whipped cream.

Break angel food cake into pieces or cut into squares.    Mix with the whip cream mixture, reserving some mixture to use as a topping for the dessert.

ingredientList:
TOPPING:
1 box 8-serving size raspberry jello
2 cups boiling water

CRUST:
3 cups mini pretzels, crushed
3/4 cup butter, melted
3 tablespoons sugar

FILLING:
1 8-ounce package cream cheese, softened
1 cup sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 8-ounce container cool whip
10 ounces raspberries, fresh or frozen unsweetened
recipeText:
In medium bowl, dissolve gelatin in boiling water; set aside to cool to room temperature.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In medium bowl, mix Crust ingredients. Press into ungreased 13x9-inch (3-quart) baking dish. Bake 10 minutes. Cool on cooling rack.

In medium bowl, beat cream cheese, 1 cup sugar and the vanilla with electric mixer on medium speed until smooth. Beat in whipped topping. Spread over cooled crust.

Spread raspberries over filling; pour cooled gelatin on top. Refrigerate 3 to 4 hours or until firm. Cut into 4 rows by 3 rows.

ingredientList:
1 cup butter
8 (8 oz) envelopes Nestle Choco Bake, unsweetened chocolate flavor
4 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
2 1/2 cups sugar
1 1/2 cups flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup chopped nuts
recipeText:
In a small saucepan, melt butter, remove from heat.  Stir in Nestle Choco Bake; cool completely.  

In small mixer bowl, beat eggs and vanilla.  Gradually add sugar, beating until pale yellow.  

Blend in chocolate mixture.  Gradually add flour and salt.  Stir in nuts.  Spread in greased 13" x 9" pan.  Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

ingredientList:
4 cups fresh strawberries, divided
1 14-ounce can sweetened condensed milk
1/4 cup lemon juice
8 ounces cool whip
8 oreo chocolate sandwich cookies, finely chopped
1 tablespoon butter, melted
recipeText:
Line an 8" x 4" loaf pan with foil.  Mash 2 cups of strawberries in a large bowl.  Stir in condensed milk, juice, and 2 cups of the cool whip.  Pour into pan.

Top with combined chopped cookies and butter; press into mixture.  Freeze at least 6 hours.  Top with remaining cool whip.

ingredientList:
1 stick margarine
1 cup flour
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 cup brown sugar
Apple slices
Cinnamon
recipeText:
Line a 9" x 9" x 2" cake pan with apple slices.  

Mix margarine, flour, and sugar.  (Can use 1 cup of sugar instead of 1/2 of each brown and regular sugar.)

Crumble mixture over the apples, and sprinkle with cinnamon.  Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/4 cup sugar
1/3 cup melted butter
16 ounces cream cheese, softened (use 8 oz for less flavor)
1/4 cup sugar
2 tablespoons milk
8 ounces cool whip
2 3 1/2-ounce boxes chocolate instant pudding & pie filling mix (8 servings)
3 1/2 cups milk
8 ounces mini semisweet chocolate chips
recipeText:
Combine crumbs, 1 1/2 cup sugar, and melted butter.  Press firmly into bottom of 13x9 inch baking pan; chill 5 minutes.  For firmer crust, bake at 375 degrees for 8 minutes, cool.  

Beat cream cheese with 1/4 cup sugar & 2 TBSP milk until smooth.  Fold in half of the whipped topping.  Spread over crust.  

Prepare pudding using 3 1/3 cup milk.  Pour pudding over cream cheese layer.  Chill several hours or overnight.  

Spread remaining whipped topping over pudding.  Sprinkle chocolate chips on top to garnish.

ingredientList:
5 cups unbleached flour
1 cup whole wheat flour
2 teaspoons salt
1 3/4 cups (or 2 cups) canola oil
7/8 cup water
8 cups peeled, cut, tart apples
4 tablespoons unbleached flour
1 tablespoon cinnamon
1 1/2 cups sugar
1/2 stick butter
recipeText:
Combine 5 cups flour, 1 cup whole wheat flour, 2 tsp salt, and canola oil, blend well.  Add the water.  Blend very well.  Press 1/2 to 2/3 of the dough into a 9" x 13" pan.  

Combine and blend the apples, 4 tablespoons flour, cinnamon, and sugar.  Put this mixture over the dough in the pan.  

Cut up 1/2 stick of butter and put spread over the apples.  

Crumble remaining crust on top of apples.  Sprinkle sugar and cinnamon over the top.

Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes, reduce heat to 375degrees and bake for another 30 minutes or until bubbly.

ingredientList:
12 vanilla wafers
12 ounces cream cheese, softened
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 eggs
Whipped cream or cool whip
1 can of your favorite pie filling
recipeText:
Line twelve muffin cups with foil bake cups. Place one cookie in each. Set aside.

In large mixing bowl beat cream cheese, sugar and vanilla on medium speed of electric mixer until fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating until just combined after each addition.

Carefully spoon about 1/4 cup cream cheese mixture into each bake cup. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

Cool completely.  Leave in foil cups or peel away bake cups. Top with fruit and cool whip.  

Store in refrigerator.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup butter, melted
16 graham crackers, crushed
1/4 cup sugar
8 ounces cream cheese
2 eggs
1/2 cup sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Cinnamon (optional)
1 can blueberry pie filling
Cool whip
recipeText:
Crust:  Mix butter, graham crackers, and 1/4 cup of sugar.  Place in a 9" x 9" pan.  

Beat cream cheese, eggs, 1/2 cup sugar, and vanilla until thick and yellow.  Pour over crust.  Bake at 300 degrees for 25 minutes.  

Sprinkle with cinnamon while hot.  Let cool.  

Spoon can of blueberry pie filling over cream cheese mixture.  Refrigerate overnight.  Top with whipped cream or cool whip when serving.

ingredientList:
1 shot vodka
1/2 shot triple sec
Splash of grenadine syrup
Orange juice
Splash of 7-Up
recipeText: Mix, serve, drink!

ingredientList:
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 tablespoons brown sugar
2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
1 teaspoon Dijon style mustard
1/4 teaspoon pepper
6 fillets salmon, thawed
recipeText:
Combine all ingredients except salmon fillets to make marinade.

Place salmon in shallow glass dish and pour 1/2 of the marinade over the salmon.  Reserve remaining marinade.

Cover and refrigerate one hour.

Discard marinade from glass dish.  Grill salmon over medium heat approximately 4 - 6 minutes.  Brush with reserved marinade several times during grilling.

ingredientList:
2 eggs
3 tablespoons sugar
1 cup milk
1 1/2 tablespoons shortening
1 pinch salt
3 cups flour
1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
Apple slices
1/2 cup sugar and cinnamon mixture
recipeText:
Mix eggs, sugar, milk, shortening, and salt together.  When well mixed, add flour & baking powder.  Press into a greased, floured 9x13 inch cake pan.  

Place apple slices in rows, sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar.  

Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

ingredientList:
Cake:
2 cups sugar
2 teaspoons baking soda
2 cups flour
2 teaspoons cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 1/2 cups oils
4 eggs
3 cups shredded carrots
3/4 cup nuts and raisins

Frosting:
4 ounces cream cheese
2 1/4 cups powdered sugar
2 teaspoons soft butter
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Pinch salt
recipeText:
Mix cake ingredients.

Pour into a greased 9" x 13" cake pan.  Bake at 350 degrees for 40 - 45 minutes.  

Let cake cool completely.

Mix frosting ingredients and frost the cake.

ingredientList:
Apple Crunch Coffee Cake
2 cups Original Bisquick
2/3 cup milk or cold water
3 tablespoons sugar
1 egg
2 cups thinly sliced apples
2/3 cup Original Bisquick
2/3 cup packed brown sugar
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
1/4 cup firm butter or margarine
2 tablespoons chopped nuts
1/2 cup powdered sugar
2 - 3 teaspoons milk
recipeText:
Heat oven to 400 degrees.  Grease square 9" x 9" x 2" pan.  Mix 2 cups Bisquick, 2/3 cup milk, 3 tablespoons of sugar, and egg; beat vigorously for 30 seconds.  Spread half of the batter in pan.  

Streusel Topping: Mix 2/3 cup Bisquick, brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg.  Cut in margarine until crumbly.

Arrange apple slices on batter; sprinkle with half of the Streusel Topping.  Spread remaining batter over apple slices; sprinkle with remaining topping.  Sprinkle with nuts.  Bake until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean, about 25 minutes.  Cool.  

Glaze:  Mix powdered sugar and 2 - 3 teaspoons milk. Drizzle over cake.

High altitude: Heat oven to 425 degrees.  Bake about 30 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 cup chopped dates
1 1/2 cups boiling water
1 3/4 teaspoons baking soda
1/2 cup shortening
1 cup sugar
2 eggs, beaten
1 1/2 cups flour
1/4 teaspoon salt

Topping:
1 package semisweet chocolate chips
1/2 cup nuts
1/2 cup sugar
recipeText:
Pour boiling water over the dates and let cool.

Cream shortening and sugar.  Add dates and remaining ingredients except topping ingredients.   Pour into a greased cake pan.  Top with chocolate chips, nuts, and 1/2 cup sugar.

Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 cup rolled oats
1 1/4 cups boiling water
1/2 cup butter, softened
1 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg

FROSTING:
6 tablespoons butter, softened
2/3 cup packed brown sugar
1/4 cup half and half
2/3 cup chopped pecans or walnuts
1 cup flaked coconut
recipeText:
Mix the cake ingredients.  Pour into a greased, floured cake pan.  Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.  

Mix the frosting ingredients.  Spread on cake.

recipeDescription: Prep Time: 15 minutes - Yield: frosts 2-layer or 13 x 9-inch cake
ingredientList:
1 cup sugar
1 cup evaporated milk
1/2 cup margarine or butter, softened
3 eggs, beaten
1 1/3 cups flaked coconut
1 cup chopped pecans or almonds
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
1. In medium saucepan, combine sugar, milk, margarine and eggs. Cook over medium heat until mixture begins to bubble, stirring constantly.

2. Stir in all remaining ingredients. Cool until of desired spreading consistency.

ingredientList:
1 box yellow (lemon) cake mix
1 package instant lemon pudding mixes
4 eggs
2/3 cup corn oil
3/4 cup water
recipeText: Add all ingredients and beat.  Don't grease the pan.  Use two 4" x 8" bread pans.  Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.  Cool completely before removing from the pan.

ingredientList:
1 white (vanilla) cake mix
6 tablespoons creme de menthe extract
1 16-ounce jar chocolate fudge topping
4 tablespoons creme de menthe extract
1 12-ounce container cool whip
recipeText:
Mix the cake mix as directed.  Add 6 tablespoons of creme de menthe.  Bake in a 9" x 13" cake pan at 350 degrees.  Let cool.

Spread jar of chocolate fudge topping over the cake.

Mix 4 tablespoons of creme de menthe into the cool whip container.  Spread over chocolate fudge.  Refrigerate. 

Can be made the day before.

ingredientList:
1 egg white
2 cups powdered sugar
1/2 cup shortening (Crisco)
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 1/2 tablespoons milk
2 tablespoons cake flour
Flavoring extract if desired
Food coloring if desired
recipeText:
Beat egg white until stiff.  Add 1 cup powdered sugar, beat.

In a separate bowl, mix 1 cup powdered sugar, shortening, salt, milk, flour, and flavoring.  Beat until well blended.  

Add the egg and powdered sugar mixture.  Beat well until the frosting stands in peaks, about 4 - 5 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 tablespoons butter or margarine
1/3 cup packed brown sugar
1 tablespoon water
1 8-ounce can pineapple slices, drained and halved
4 maraschino cherries, halved
1 1/3 cups flour
2/3 cup sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
2/3 cup milk
1/4 cup butter or margarine
1 egg
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
In a saucepan, melt 2 tablespoons butter, add brown sugar and water, stir until dissolved.  Remove from heat.  Pour mixture into bottom of cake pan.  

Place pineapple slices on top of sugar mixture.  Fill center of each pineapple with a cherry.  

In a mixing bowl, combine the remaining ingredients.  Beat 2 minutes.  Pour batter over pineapple, being careful not to disturb the fruit.  

Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.  Let stand 5 minutes.  Loosen edges and invert cake onto a platter.

ingredientList:
7 ounces small macaroni
1 medium onion, chopped
1 small green pepper, chopped
1 pound ground beef
1 cup cottage cheese
2 1/2 cups spaghetti sauce
1 4-ounce can mushrooms
2 teaspoons oregano
1 cup sour cream
1/4 cup Parmesan cheese, shredded
recipeText:
Cook macaroni, rinse, drain.  Brown the meat.  Saute the pepper and onion.  Add the remaining ingredients and cooked macaroni to a 3-quart casserole.  

Bake 45 minutes at 350 degrees covered.  

Remove the cover, sprinkle cheese on top and bake for another 15 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 pounds ground beef
1 cup diced celery
1/2 cup chopped onions
1 pound wide noodles
1 8-ounce can mushroom pieces
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1 can cream of celery soup
1 can cheddar cheese soup
1 tablespoon Natures Seasoning*
recipeText:
Brown beef.  Pre-cook celery and onion in water to cover, until barely tender.  Cook noodles for about 5 minutes and drain.  

Combine meat, celery with cooking liquids, mushrooms with liquid in can, and all soups and Natures Seasoning.  Mix thoroughly.  Add noodles and mix in.  

Put into Pam sprayed roaster pan.  Cover and refrigerate overnight or 6 - 8 hours to blend flavors. 

Bake at 300 degrees until heated through, approximately 1 - 2 hours.  Stir once or twice so it heats evenly.  Add a little water if mixture seems dry.

*Natures Seasoning can be found in the spice section of grocery stores.  It is made by Mortons Salt Co. and can be used in many dishes.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup onions
1/3 cup celery
1 pound ground beef
Dash salt
Dash pepper
1 can cream of mushroom soup  (or cream of celery soup)
16 ounces frozen tater tots
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
recipeText:
Grease a 9" x 13" (2-quart) baking dish.  Brown onions, celery, and beef.  Drain off grease.  Spread mixture into the baking dish and sprinkle with salt and pepper.  

Pour can of soup over the mixture (an additional can is optional and makes the meal more juicy).  Top with frozen tater tots.

Bake at 400 degrees for 45 minutes, when mixture is bubbly.  Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and bake until cheese is melted.

ingredientList:
1 pound egg noodles, cooked and drained
1 onion
1 cup celery
5 tablespoons margarine or butter
4 cups chicken
1 can cream of mushroom soup
3 cups chicken broth
6 tablespoons flour
Dash salt
Dash pepper
1 cup grated cheddar cheese
recipeText:
Dice onion and celery, cook in butter.  Add chicken, soup, broth, and flour.  Salt and pepper to taste.  Sprinkle on cheese.  

Bake at 350 degrees  for 1 hour.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup raw carrots, cut up
1/2 cup celery, cut fine
3 cups cooked turkey
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1 1/2 cups milk
1/2 package onion soup mix
1 can drained asparagus or peas
Cooked noodles
recipeText: Mix all ingredients except noodles.  Place noodles in a pan.  Pour mixture over noodles and bake until carrots and celery are soft.

ingredientList:
1 pound ground beef
1/2 cup onions
5 potatoes
4 carrots
1 cup celery (optional)
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1 cup water
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce (optional)
1 can corn
recipeText:
Brown the beef and the onions.  Chop potatoes, carrots, and celery.  Mix all ingredients and place in a cake pan.

Bake at 350 degrees for 30 - 40 minutes.

ingredientList:
3 cups sugar
3 cups water
1 6-ounce can orange juice concentrate
recipeText: Heat water and dissolve sugar.  Add orange juice and boil.  Set aside to cool.  Pour over fresh fruit and freeze.

ingredientList:
6 cups cooked rhubarb
Sure Jell
4 cups sugar
1 can strawberry pie filling
1 small box jello
recipeText:
Mix Sure Jell with rhubarb.  Add sugar and let stand overnight.  

Boil rhubarb mixture for 20 minutes.  Add strawberry pie filling.  Boil for 5 minutes.  Add 1 small box of jello.

ingredientList:
1/2 of a chicken or 1 pound of hamburger
6 tablespoons soy sauce
1 cup water
1 large bunch of celery, cut in 1/2 inch pieces
1 small onion, chopped
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1/4 cup water
1 10 1/2-ounce can water chestnuts, drained & sliced
2 1/2 cups bean sprouts, drained
2 ounces can mushrooms
Dash salt
Dash pepper
1 can chow main mixed vegetables
1 bag chow main noodles
recipeText:
Brown meat in oil or meat fat.  Add soy sauce and 1 cup of water.  Simmer 2 minutes.

Add celery and onion.  Simmer 1.5 hours.  

Blend corn starch and 1/4 cup water; stir into meat mixture.  Add chestnuts, bean sprouts, veggies, and mushrooms.  

Heat through, season and serve over chow main noodles, or cool and freeze.

ingredientList:
1 can (4.5 ounce) Swanson Premium chunk breast of chicken, drained
1/4 cup chopped celery
1 tablespoon finely chopped onions
3 tablespoons mayonnaise
Dash pepper
recipeText: Mix all ingredients.  Serve on bread with lettuce and tomato.

ingredientList:
6 cups soft bread crumbs
1 1/2 cups milk
4 eggs
3 pounds ground beef (90% lean or better)
1 pound ground pork (Jimmy Dean's Hot Sausage works great)
2 finely chopped onions
2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
1 tablespoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1 cup ketchup
recipeText:
Soak bread in milk.  Add eggs and beat with rotary beater.  Add meat, onion, celery, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and 1/4 cup catsup.  

Form into 2 loaves for 8 servings, for 16 servings, 4 loaves .  Place in loaf pan or 13x9x2 inch baking pan.  

Bake, uncovered at 350 degrees for 1 hour. 

Spread the rest of the catsup over top of loaves and bake extra 15 minutes.

ingredientList:
Pork (spare ribs, chops, etc.)
1 cup chopped onions
2 tablespoons brown sugar
1/4 teaspoon chili powder
1 teaspoon salt
2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
1 cup tomato juice
1/2 cup water
1 tablespoon paprika
1 teaspoon dry mustard
1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper
1/4 cup vinegar
1/4 cup catsup
recipeText:
Pour chopped onions over pork.  Cover and bake at 450 degrees for 30 minutes.  

Mix and simmer remaining ingredients for 15 minutes.

Pour sauce over meat.  Reduce oven heat to 350 degrees and cook for additional for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.  Continually baste meat with sauce.  Add water to keep pork from browning.  Keep pork covered.

ingredientList:
1 tablespoon dried parsley
1 tablespoon dried chives
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
6 boneless skinless chicken breast halves
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
3 tablespoons butter, cut into 6 equal slices
1 tablespoon seasoned bread crumbs, divided
1/8 teaspoon paprika
recipeText:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.  

In a small bowl, combine the parsley, chives, and garlic powder; set aside.  

Between 2 pieces of waxed paper, gently pound the chicken to 1/4-inch thickness with a mallet or rolling pin.  

Sprinkle both sides of each breast lightly with salt and pepper, then sprinkle 1 teaspoon of the parsley mixture on one side of each chicken piece.  

Place a slice of butter in the center of each piece of chicken and roll each chicken breast tightly, tucking in the sides as you roll.  

Place the rolls seam side down in medium-sized muffin tins that have been coated with nonstick vegetable spray; sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon of the seasoned bread crumbs and some paprika over each roll.  

Bake for 25 - 30 minutes until no pink remains and juices run clear.  Serve immediately.

ingredientList:
3 tablespoons fresh lime juice
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 tablespoon chopped fresh tarragon or thyme, divided
1/2 teaspoon grated lemon peels
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
1 1/4 pounds beef tenderloin filets, cut 1 inch thick.
1/3 cup sour cream
1 teaspoon Dijon style mustard
recipeText:
In a resealable plastic bag, combine lemon juice, olive oil, 2 teaspoons of the tarragon, lemon peel, salt, and pepper; add steaks.  Turn to coat well; seal bag and chill 2 to 24 hours, turning occasionally.

Meanwhile, for sauce, in a small bowl stir together sour cream, mustard, and remaining 1 teaspoon tarragon.  Cover and chill until serving time.

Preheat grill to medium.  Remove steak from marinade; discard marinade.  Grill 8 - 12 minutes for medium rare, or 12 - 15 minutes for medium.

Serve with sauce.  Garnish with additional fresh tarragon, if desired.

ingredientList:
3 medium potatoes, thinly sliced
2 large carrots, thinly sliced
1 onion, sliced
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
4 pounds beef rump roast
1/2 cup water
2 packages onion soup mix, dry
recipeText:
Put vegetables in the bottom of the crock-pot.  Salt and pepper meat, then put in pot.  Sprinkle on onion soup mix.  Add liquid.  

Cover, cook on low 10 - 12 hours (high 5-6 hours).

ingredientList:
2 teaspoons butter
1 cup onions
1 1/2 cups diced celery
2 pounds ground beef
1 tablespoon mustard
1/2 cup water
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
1 teaspoon chili powder
1 1/2 tablespoons vinegar
3 tablespoons sugar
1 bottle (small) ketchup
recipeText: Brown beef and drain grease.  Mix all ingredients together and simmer.

ingredientList:
4 pounds ground beef
1 pound pork sausages 
4 cups bread crumbs
3 eggs
3 cups milk
3/4 cup minced onions
3/4 teaspoon ginger
3/4 teaspoon nutmeg
3/4 teaspoon pepper
2 tablespoons salt
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients together and cook in frying pan.  Use extra milk in the pan as needed to prevent burning.

To make the gravy, add extra milk and flour to the pan grease.  Stir until thick and pour over meatballs.  Add extra ginger, nutmeg, and pepper as needed.

ingredientList:
1/3 cup water
1 tablespoon cornstarch
2 tablespoons soy sauce
2 tablespoons honey
1/2 teaspoon ginger
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon cinnamon
2 tablespoons oil
3/4 pound boneless beef sirloin steaks, slightly frozen, cut into paper-thin strips about 2" x 1"
2 cloves garlic,minced
1 1/2 pounds assorted, cut-up fresh vegetables
recipeText:
In a small bowl, blend water, cornstarch, soy sauce, honey, ginger, salt, and cinnamon; set aside.  

Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat until hot.  Add 1 tablespoon of oil; heat until it ripples.  Add beef and garlic.  Cook and stir 3 to 4 minutes or until browned.  Remove and reserve beef and any liquid in skillet.

In the same skillet, over medium heat, heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil until it ripples.  Add firm vegetables (broccoli, carrots, cauliflower); cook and stir 2 minutes or until vegetables are slightly limp.  

Add less firm vegetables (onions, green or red bell peppers); cook and stir 2 - 3 minutes.  Add soft vegetables (mushrooms, bean sprouts, pea pods), cook and stir 1 - 2 minutes or until all vegetables are crisp-tender.  

Return beef and any liquid to skillet; stir in sauce mixture.  Cook and stir until sauce is bubble and thickened.  If using tomatoes, stir and heat until warm.  Serve with hot cooked rice or Chinese noodles, if desired.

ingredientList:
2 cups flour
4 teaspoons baking powder
3/4 teaspoon salt
2 tablespoons fat
2 eggs
1/4 cup milk
recipeText: Mix all ingredients.  Cover and cook dumplings for about 12 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 cup ketchup
1 1/2 cups mozola oil
3/4 cup sugar
1/4 cup vinegar
1 teaspoon paprika
1 teaspoon celery salt
1 teaspoon grated onions
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon pepper
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
Juice of one lemon
1 clove garlic
recipeText: Mix all ingredients in mixer for 15 minutes.  Drop a clove of garlic in bottom of jar when you pour dressing into the jar.  Store in the refrigerator.

ingredientList:
4 cups mashed potatoes
1/4 cup crisco
1/4 cup butter
1/2 cup cream
1 tablespoon sugar
1 teaspoon salt (or slightly more)
3 cups flour
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients except flour.  Let it sit overnight.

Cool throughly.  Then add the flour.  Roll out dough and fry at 450 degrees to 500 degrees.

recipeName: Lefse - altered to include potato ingredients
ingredientList:
2-2/3 cups instant Idahoan potatoes flakes
2-2/3 cups water
1 cup milk
1/4 cup crisco
6 tablespoons butter
1/2 cup cream
1 tablespoon sugar
1-1/2 teaspoons salt (or slightly more)
3 cups flour
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients except flour.  Let it sit overnight.

Cool throughly.  Then add the flour.  Roll out dough and fry at 450 degrees to 500 degrees.

ingredientList:
2 eggs
1 cup milk
1 cup flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
recipeText:
Generously grease six 6-ounce custard cups or 8 muffin cups.  Set aside.

In large mixing bowl beat eggs.  Add remaining ingredients and beat on low speed just until smooth.  Fill cups about 3/4 full with batter.

Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes, then reduce to 325 degrees and bake for 15 minutes longer, or until deep golden brown.

Remove from pan and serve warm.

ingredientList:
1 8-ounce can tomato sauce
2 teaspoons dried oregano or basil
1 clove minced garlic
recipeText: Mix all ingredients together.  Makes 1 1/2 cup.

ingredientList:
2 eggs
1 teaspoon sugar
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup milk
1 cup flour
Frosting:
3 cups sifted powdered sugar
2/3 cup shortening Crisco
2 1/2 tablespoons water
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Use a fork to beat eggs, sugar, and salt.  Don't beat too much or they will have too much air in them.  Add flour.  Then slowly add milk while keeping bumps out of the batter.  

Heat lard to 350 degrees to 360 degrees; put rosette iron into lard and heat.  Dip iron into batter, then into lard for frying.  Fry about one minute.  

Mix frosting ingredients and frost rosettes.

ingredientList:
1 cup dates (cut fine)
1 cup chopped nuts
1 can Eagle Brand Milk
1 box Ritz crackers
1 stick butter
2 cups powdered sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Milk
recipeText:
Put dates and milk in a double boiler.  Cook about 8 - 10 minutes or until mixture thickens.  Take off heat and add nuts.  Cover each Ritz cracker with mixture.  

Bake at 300 degrees for 5 - 10 minutes.  Cool.  

Mix butter and powdered sugar, and enough milk to make spreading easy.  Frost crackers.

Makes 5 dozen.

recipeDescription: From Alice Lendt.  These are so yummy, a child favorite!
ingredientList:
4 - 6 apples
1 1/2 cups water
2 cups sugar
1/2 cup vinegar
6 whole cloves
1 - 2 sticks cinnamon
Red food coloring
recipeText:
Wash, peel, and core apples.  Slice them 1/2 inch thick.

Make a syrup of the sugar, water, and vinegar.  Tied cloves and cinnamon in a bag.  Cook the apples and spices in the syrup, turning often until the fruit is clear.

Remove the apples and spice bag from the mixture.

Add red food coloring to the syrup.  Pour the syrup over the apples.  Cool.  Makes 12 - 16 rings.

ingredientList:
1/4 cup brown sugar
1/4 cup dark corn syrup
2 tablespoons butter or margarine
1/2 teaspoon salt
3 cups Kix cereal
1 cup walnuts
Ice cream
recipeText:
Heat oven to 325 degrees.  Butter a cookie sheet pan 15 1/2" x 10 1/2" x 1".  Heat brown sugar, corn syrup, butter, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat; stirring constantly until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes.

Remove from heat; stir in cereal and walnuts until well coated.  Spread mixture evenly in pan.  Bake uncovered 15 minutes.  Cool 10 minutes.  Loosen mixture with metal spatula.  Let stand firm, about 30 minutes; break apart.  

Serve over ice cream.  Store in airtight container.  About 6 cups of topping.

ingredientList:
1 cup flour
1 egg
1 teaspoon baking powder
A little water
recipeText: Mix ingredients together.  Drop into simmering soup.  Cover and cook for about 15 - 20 minutes.

ingredientList:
3 - 3 1/2 cups flour
1 package Fletschmans Rapid Yeast
1 cup very warm water (125 to 130 degrees)
2 tablespoons oils
3/4 teaspoon salt
recipeText:
Mix 2 cups flour, yeast, salt, and oil.  Stir in the water.  Stir in more flour, enough to make the dough soft.  

Knead the dough for 4 - 6 minutes on a floured board.  Divide to make balls.  

Makes two 12-inch pizzas.

ingredientList:
1 cup flour
1 egg
Cottage cheese
1 egg yolk
Sugar
Cinnamon
recipeText:
Mix flour and 1 egg.  Roll out dough, make squares.

Mix cottage cheese, egg yolk, sugar, and cinnamon.  Close and seal tight.

Drop into boiling salted water.  Cut extra dough in little pieces - brown in butter - and pour over dumplings after they are cooked, and in the serving bowl.

ingredientList:
1 gallon large cucumbers rings, about 15 cucumbers
2 cups dehydrated limes
8 1/2 quarts water
1 cup white vinegar
1 tablespoon alum
1 small bottle red food coloring
2 cups vinegar
10 cups sugar
2 cups water
8 cinnamon sticks
1 package red hot candies
recipeText:
Put cucumber rings in lime water and let stand for 24 hours.  

Drain rings and wash in cool water.  Cover with cold water and let stand 3 hours.  

Drain and add 1 cup white vinegar, alum, and small bottle of red food coloring.  Water to cover.  Heat and simmer 2 hours, then drain well and discard liquid.  

Create syrup by bring remaining ingredients to a boil and pour over the rings.  Keep lid on tight and let stand overnight.  

Drain and reheat the syrup for 3 mornings.  The 4th morning, heat rings and syrup to boil.  Pack in sterilized jars and seal.  Makes 4 -5 quarts.

ingredientList:
3 cups vinegar
1 cup water
4 cups sugar
1/4 cup salt
1 1/2 teaspoons turmeric
1 1/8 teaspoons dry mustard
recipeText: Slice pickles and onions.  Mix all ingredients and put in jars.  Shake back and forth several times during the day.  Keep refrigerated.

ingredientList:
1 cup flour
1/8 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup Crisco shortening
3 tablespoons water
1/4 cup butter or margarine, softened
1 cup sugar
4 eggs
3/4 cup light corn syrup
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 1/4 cups pecan halves
recipeText:
For Crust:  Combine flour and salt.  Cut in Crisco with pastry blender or knife until flour is just blended into form of pea-size chunks.  Add all water.  Toss lightly with fork until dough forms a ball.  

Press between hands to form 5" to 6" pancake.  Flour rolling surface and pin lightly.  Roll dough into circle and trim 1" larger than upside-down 9" pie plate.  

Loosen dough carefully.  Fold into quarters.  Unfold and press into pie plate.  Fold edge under and flute as desired.  

For Filling:  Cream butter and sugar in a mixing bowl.  Beat in eggs, syrup, and vanilla.  Stir in pecans.  Pour filling into unbaked pie shell.  

Bake at 375 degrees for 5 minutes.  Reduce heat to 325 degrees.  Bake for 45 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.  

Cool to room temperature before cutting.  Makes one 9" pie.

ingredientList:
1 cup flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/3 cup shortening
1 tablespoon shortening
2 tablespoons water
recipeText: Sift flour and salt together.  Using a fork, cut in shortening.  For a flaky crust, do not over mix.  Overmixing causes the crust to be thick and dough-like.  Mix in water until mixture is slightly wet.  Roll out crust and press into pie pan.

ingredientList:
2 cups water
1 1/2 cups sugar
1/3 cup cornstarch
1/2 cup corn syrup
Red food coloring
1 package raspberry jello
2 cups or more of raspberries
1 baked pie shell
Cool whip
recipeText:
Mix water, sugar, cornstarch, corn syrup, and food coloring and bring to a boil.  Add jello and cook for 4 minutes.  Let cool slightly.

Add raspberries and pour into a baked pie shell.  Chill.

Top with whipped cream or cool whip.

ingredientList:
2 1/2 cups lightly toasted coconut
1/3 cup margarine
3 ounces cream cheese, softened
14 ounces sweetened condensed milk
2 1/2 cups strawberries, mashed or pureed (about 1 1/2 cups)
3 tablespoons lemon juice
1/2 pint heavy cream, whipped
recipeText:
In a large saucepan, melt margarine; stir in toasted coconut.  Mix well.  Press into the bottom and up sides of 9-inch pie pan; chill.  In large bowl, beat cheese until fluffy, beat in condensed milk.  Sir in pureed strawberries and lemon juice.  Fold in whipped cream.  

Pour into coconut crust (mixture should move slightly).  Freeze 4 hours or until form.  

Before serving, garnish with additional fresh strawberries.

ingredientList:
1 cup Original Bisquick
1/4 cup butter
3 tablespoons hot water
1 cup fresh strawberries
2/3 cup water
1 cup sugar
3 tablespoons cornstarch
1/3 cup water
3 cups whole strawberries
recipeText:
Make a pie crust by mixing Bisquick with butter and 3 tablespoons hot water.  Pat into a pie pan and bake at 350 degrees for 8 - 10 minutes.  Cool completely.

Glaze:  For 3 minutes, simmer 1 cup of fresh strawberries with 2/3 cup of water.   Then combine 1 cup sugar, cornstarch, and 1/3 cup water and bring all to a good boil.  

Put 3 cups of strawberries in the cooled crust.  Pour glaze mixture over the strawberries.

Chill several hours.

recipeDescription:
Preparation Time: 8 minutes 
Total Time: 8 minutes
ingredientList:
1 (3 1/2-ounce) package strawberry jello (4-serving size)
2/3 cup boiling water
2 cups ice cubes
1 (8-ounce) container non-dairy frozen whipped topping, thawed
1 cup sliced fresh strawberries
1 graham cracker pie crust
recipeText:
1. In small bowl dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Add ice. Stir for 2 to 3 minutes or until gelatin thickens. Remove and discard unmelted ice.

2. Whisk in whipped topping. Fold in strawberries. Refrigerate, if necessary, until mixture mounds when spooned.

3. Spoon into crust. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or until set. Garnish as desired. Store in refrigerator.

Alternative fruits:
1 cup diced orange sections, banana, or fresh peaches.
1 can 8-3/4 ounces apricots, sliced peaches, or pear halves, drained and diced.

ingredientList:
2 pounds frozen hash brown potatoes
1 can potato soup
1 can cream of celery soup
8 ounces sour cream
Chopped onion greens
Dash parsley flakes
1 cup grated cheddar cheese
recipeText:
Put hash browns in bowl and break up.  Let stand and thaw 1 hour or more.  Add soups and sour cream and mix well.

Place in a 9" x 13" pan.  Sprinkle with parsley and cheese.  

Bake at 300 degrees for 1 1/2 hours or until brown on sides of pan.

ingredientList:
2 pounds frozen hash brown potatoes
1 can cream of celery soup
1 cup cream of mushroom soup
8 ounces sour cream and chives
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients except cheese in layers.  

Bake at 300 degrees for 2 to 4 hours or until brown on sides of pan.  Stir two times (not more often as it will make the potatoes mushy).  Sprinkle cheddar cheese on top before serving.

ingredientList:
2 pounds chunk frozen hash brown potatoes
1 can cream of chicken soup
3/4 cup chopped onions
1 stick melted butter or margarine
8 ounces shredded cheddar cheese
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon garlic salt
1 cup sour cream
2 cups crushed corn flakes
recipeText:
Mix hash browns, soup, onion, 1/2 stick melted margarine, salts, cheddar cheese, and sour cream together, put in baking dish.

Mix 1/2 stick melted margarine & corn flakes, and place over the top of potato mixture.

Bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours.

ingredientList:
2 pounds red potatoes, sliced 1/2 inch thick
1/3 cup vegetable oil
1 envelope onion soup mix
recipeText:
Combine all ingredients in a large plastic bag; shake until well coated. Empty bag into an ungreased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking pan. 

Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes, stirring occasionally. Uncover and bake 15 minutes longer or until potatoes are tender.  Can garnish with chopped parsley if desired.

ingredientList:
2 pounds frozen hash brown potatoes
1 cup chopped onions
1 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1/2 cup melted butter or margarine
1 pint sour cream
1 large can cheese whiz
1 can cream of chicken soup
2 cups crushed corn flakes
recipeText:
Mix hash browns, onions, salt, and 1/4 cup margarine.  

Mix sour cream, cheese, and soup. Heat until mixed well.  Pour over potatoes.

Mix 1/4 cup margarine & corn flakes, and sprinkle over the top of potato mixture.

Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 package (3-1/2 ounce) instant vanilla pudding
1 1/2 cups cold milk
2 cups cool whip
1 20-ounce can fruit cocktail, drained
1 16-ounce can pineapple chunks, drained
1 (11-ounce) can mandarin oranges
8 ounces miniature marshmallows
3 bananas, sliced
recipeText:
Combine pudding mix and milk in a bowl.  Mix well. Fold in whipped topping.    

Add remaining ingredients, except bananas, and chill.  

Just before serving, fold in sliced bananas.

ingredientList:
1/4 cup sugar
2 tablespoons flour
1 egg
Juice from fruit cocktail
Any fruits you want
recipeText:
Boil the ingredients (except fruit) until thick.  

Then add whatever fruits you desire.

ingredientList:
1/4 cup sugar
1 tablespoon cider vinegar
1 16-ounce carton heavy cream
Romaine lettuce
recipeText:
Whip the cream into semi-thick consistency, add sugar and vinegar and whip until mixed.  

Chop lettuce and mix into cream mixture.  Serve.

ingredientList:
2 cups cooked rice, cold
14 ounces can crushed pineapple, drained
1/4 cup sugar
1 cup mini marshmallows
1 cup whipping cream
1 tablespoon sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 jar maraschino cherries
recipeText:
Mix rice, pineapple, 1/4 cup. sugar and marshmallows in a bowl.

Whip cream, 1 tablespoon sugar, and vanilla until stiff.

Fold into rice mixture.

Chill.

Decorate with maraschino cherries or slices of fresh pineapple.

ingredientList:
1 11-ounce can mandarin oranges
1 20-ounce can pineapple tidbits
1/2 cup maraschino cherries
2 cups cottage cheese
1 3-ounce box orange jello
9 ounces cool whip
recipeText: Mix all together and chill 2 hours.

ingredientList:
4 3-ounce packages jello, any flavor
2 1/2 cups boiling water or apple juice
recipeText:
Completely dissolve gelatin in boiling water.  Pour into a 13" x 9" pan.  Chill until firm, about 3 hours.  

Cut into squares or use cookie cutters to make different shapes.  

To remove shapes, dip pan in warm water for approximately 15 seconds. Lift shapes from pan.

ingredientList:
1 cup shredded coconut
1 cup nuts
1 cup marshmallows
1 cup cottage cheese
1 cup sour cream
1 cup crushed pineapple, well drained
1 cup fruit cocktail, drained
recipeText: Combine all ingredients.  Refrigerate overnight.

ingredientList:
2 packages strawberry jello
2 cups boiling water
2 boxes frozen strawberries, thawed
1 20-ounce can crushed pineapple
2 large bananas, mashed
3/4 cup cultured sour cream
Walnuts (optional)
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients except sour cream.  

Put half of the mixture in a mold and chill until set.  

Add sour cream to the other half of the jello mixture and pour over set jello.

ingredientList:
1 16-ounce bag macaroni, cooked, drained, cooled
1 9-ounce package tuna
2 bread and butter pickles
1/4 cup miracle whip
recipeText: Mix the above ingredients together.  Serve cold.

ingredientList:
1 3-ounce box lime jello
1 3-ounce box cherry jello
1 3-ounce box lemon jello
1 20-ounce can crushed pineapple
1 8-ounce package cream cheese
1 cup heavy cream
4 1/2 cups water
recipeText:
Dissolve lime jello in one cup of boiling water.  Add 1/2 cup cold water (or less for firmer jello).  Pour into a 9" x 9" pan.  Cool.  

Repeat with each of the other flavors.  

Whip the heavy cream until stiff peaks form.  Mix in the cream cheese and crushed pineapple.  

Cut jello into squares.  Gently fold the jello squares into the cream mixture.  Chill until ready to serve.

ingredientList:
1 head broccoli, small pieces
1/2 red onion, sliced thin
8 slices bacon, fried and crumbled
1/2 cup cashews, split (can also use pecans)
1 cup chopped celery
1 - 2 cups green and red grapes, may be sliced or left whole
1 cup miracle whip
1/3 cup sugar
1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar (or a little more)
recipeText:
Mix the miracle whip, sugar, and vinegar.  

Add the other ingredients an hour or two before serving.

ingredientList:
2 eggs
8 ounces corkscrew pasta
1 cup sugar snap peas, about 4 oz, trimmed
1/2 cup buttermilk
1/3 cup mayonnaise
3 tablespoons chopped fresh dill, divided
1 teaspoon cider vinegar
3/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1 cup diced celery
1 diced carrot
3 radishes, halved and sliced
1/4 cup chopped gherkin pickles
2 tablespoons chopped red onions
12 ounces solid white tuna in water, drained
1 head Boston lettuce, separated into leaves
recipeText:
In a pot over high heat, combine eggs with enough water to cover by 1"; bring to boil.  Cover.  Remove from heat; let stand 15 minutes.  Drain.  Cover eggs with cold water.  When cool, peel and chop.  

Cook pasta according to package directions, adding snap peas during last 2 minutes of cooking time.  Drain; rinse under cold water.  Drain; set aside.  

In a large bowl combine buttermilk, mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons dill, vinegar, salt and pepper.  Stir in pasta mixture, celery, carrots, radishes, pickles, and onion.  Gently stir in tuna.  

Arrange lettuce in large shallow serving bowl.  Spoon pasta into center.  Sprinkle with egg and remaining dill.

ingredientList:
2 tablespoons salad oil
2 tablespoons orange juice
2 tablespoons vinegar
1 teaspoon salt
3 cups cooked chicken, diced
1 cup mandarin oranges, drained
1 cup pineapple tidbits, drained
1 cup red or green seedless grapes
1 cup slivered almonds
1 cup celery, cut up
3/4 cup mayonnaise (not miracle whip)
recipeText:
Combine oil, juice, vinegar, and salt.  Add chicken and marinade for 15 minutes.

Combine oranges, pineapple, grapes, almonds, and celery.  Add to chicken mixture.  Fold in mayo.

ingredientList:
1 package cherry jello
1 package lemon jello
2 cups hot water
1 apple, well chopped
1 peeled orange, keep peel and chop
1 pound cranberries
1 cup sugar
recipeText: Mix all ingredients and let set.

ingredientList:
1/3 cup water
1/3 cup vinegar
1 teaspoon sugar
Onions
Cucumbers
Dash salt
recipeText: Mix water, vinegar, sugar, and onions.  Salt the cucumbers and soak in mixture.

ingredientList:
7 cucumbers, sliced
1/2 cup peppers, cut small
1 cup onions, cut small
2 cups sugar
1 cup vinegar
recipeText: Mix all ingredients.  Let stand 1/2 to 1 hour.  You can freeze this if desired.

ingredientList:
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup pineapple juice
2 egg yolks, beaten
1 cup whipped cream
1 can pineapple tidbits
1 can fruit cocktail
1 cup miniature marshmallows
2 or 3 bananas, sliced
Nuts
recipeText:
Cook the cornstarch, sugar, salt, pineapple juice, and egg yolks until thick.  

Add the remaining ingredients except bananas.  Chill overnight.  Add bananas before serving.

ingredientList:
10 ounces frozen raspberries, blueberries, strawberries, peaches, or mixed fruit
1 cup water
1/4 cup sugar
2 cinnamon sticks
Dash nutmeg
Dash ground cloves
1 tablespoon water
1 tablespoon cornstarch
2 tablespoons lemon juice
1 cup sour cream
1/2 cup milk
recipeText:
Drain fruit, save syrup.  In saucepan, combine syrup, 1 cup water, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves.  Boil.  Reduce heat & simmer for 5 minutes.  Remove cinnamon sticks.  

Blend 1 TBSP water and cornstarch; stir into saucepan.  Cook & stir until thickened and bubbly.  Remove from heat.  Add lemon juice.  

Cool to room temperature.  Blend in sour cream and fruit.  Stir in milk.  Cover and chill.

ingredientList:
3 tablespoons tapioca
1 cup water
1/2 cup sugar
6 ounces frozen orange juice concentrate
1 box frozen strawberries
16 ounces pineapple tidbits (with juice)
1 can mandarin oranges, drained
1 can mixed fruits, drained
recipeText:
Cook tapioca, water, and sugar until thick, then add the other ingredients.

Chill.  Serve in sherbet glass with a dab of whipped cream.

ingredientList:
8 slices bacon, cut into small pieces (or use bacon bits)
1 cup chopped onions (or used equivalent in dry minced onions)
1 cup sour cream
1 small can cream of chicken soup
Dash salt
Dash pepper
2 tablespoons parsley flakes
1 quart cubed potatoes
1/4 cup milk
recipeText:
Brown bacon and onions.  Drain fat and add to potatoes.  Cover with just enough water to cook until potatoes are tender.  

Add sour cream and chicken soup, and enough milk to achieve desired consistency.  Heat until hot, but do not boil.  Sprinkle with parsley flakes.  

Refrigerate overnight to achieve better flavor.

ingredientList:
1 cup uncooked wild rice
3 cups boiling water
2 strips smoked bacon
1/4 cup chopped onions
3/4 cup sliced celery
1/2 cup sliced carrots
14 1/2 ounces chicken broth
2 cans cream of mushroom soup
2 soup cans full of milk
1 4-ounce can mushrooms, undrained
1 teaspoon seasoned salt
Dash pepper
recipeText:
Combine rice and boiling water in large saucepan; simmer, covered, 50 - 60 minutes.  Drain off excess liquid and set aside.  

In a skillet, fry bacon until crisp.  Remove bacon, crumble and set aside.  

Drain all but 1 tablespoon of drippings; saute onion, celery, and carrots. 

In a large kettle, combine broth, soup, milk, mushrooms, seasoned salt, pepper, and crumbled bacon, sauteed vegetables, and wild rice.  

Cover and simmer for 1 hour.

ingredientList:
3 slices bacon (cut into 1-inch pieces)
1 can (6.5 - 7.5 ounces) minced clams, drained with juice set aside
1 medium onion, chopped
1 large potato, cubed
1 can cream of celery soup
1 1/2 cups milk
Dash pepper
Oyster crackers
recipeText:
Fry bacon in medium skillet over medium heat until crisp.  Remove bacon to paper towel to drain.  Discard all but two tablespoons bacon drippings.  Saute onions in drippings 4 - 5 minutes.  

Add the clam juice and potatoes.  Cover and cook over low heat until potatoes are tender (about 15 minutes).  Reserve a few pieces of bacon for garnish.  

Add remaining bacon, minced clams, cream of celery soup, milk, and pepper.  Cook over low heat until heated through.  

Garnish with reserved bacon.  Serve with crackers if desired.

recipeDescription:
This is the best recipe we have.  Grandpa added a little of this and a little of that.
It is very hard to know exactly how he made his beans.
ingredientList:
2 pounds navy beans
1 tablespoon baking soda
1 tablespoon vinegar
1 pound ham pieces and fat
1 pound bacon pieces (not sure if he used this ingredient)
1-2 tablespoons mustard
1-2 tablespoons vinegar
1 32-ounce bottle ketchup
1 cup brown sugar
recipeText:
Wash beans, cover with water, mixed with baking soda and 1 tablespoon vinegar.  Soak overnight.

Next day, drain off water.  Add fresh water and cook beans on stove-top until beans stop foaming and are about 2/3 done.  Spoon off any foam.

Add ham pieces and fat (and bacon pieces if used).  Add mustard, extra vinegar, ketchup, and brown sugar.  

Heat oven to 400 degrees and bake beans in large pan.  When oven reaches 400 degrees, turn down to 250 degrees - 300 degrees.

Cook for 5-6 hours, stirring often.   You may add more brown sugar to taste.

recipeName: Grandpa Kuntz's Baked Beans - In Grandma's Handwriting
ingredientList:
4 pounds navy beans
3 teaspoons salt
1 teaspoon pepper
1/2 cup brown sugar
1 quart tomato juice
2 cups water
2 pounds cut up ham or pork pieces and fat
1/2 cup molasses
Ketchup, to taste
recipeText:
Wash beans, cover with water, (mixed with baking soda and 1 tablespoon vinegar -- this isn't in Grandma's recipe but is supposed to help reduce gas) Soak overnight.

Next day, drain off water.  Add fresh water and cook beans on stove-top until beans stop foaming and are about 2/3 done.  Spoon off any foam.

Add remaining ingredients and bake in medium oven until done.

ingredientList:
2 10 3/4-ounce cans cream of mushroom soup
1 cup milk
2 teaspoons soy sauce
1/4 teaspoon black pepper
8 cups cooked cut green beans
2 2/3 cups French-fried onions
recipeText:
In a 3 qt casserole bowl, mix all ingredients except 2/3 cup onions.  

Bake 350 degrees for 25 minutes, or until hot.  

Stir.  Top with remaining onions.  Bake 5 more minutes.
